other_tests.findings: During ERCP, an EGD showed severely tight ring in the cricopharyngeus; at the level of the duodenum, there was evidence of a biliary stone which most probably passed spontaneously through the major papilla into the duodenal lumen.

other_tests.procedure_name: Ultrasound of the Liver or Gallbladder (Single Organ)
other_tests.findings: The liver is diffusely echogenic with smooth contours; intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation and mild CBD dilation up to 9 mm; two stones are noted within the common bile duct, largest measuring 1.1 x 1.4 x 0.7 cm; gallbladder is distended with mild wall edema and layering luminal sludge.
